[Admin: sorry Jan, this (and the next) got stuck in the spam filter - MB]

=
On Jul 19, 2012, at 9:09 PM, Erik Mogensen wrote:

>
>
> Den 19. juli 2012 =
16:40 skrev "Peter Williams" <pezra@...> f=F8lgende:
> >
> >
>=
 >
> > On Wed, Jul 18, 2012 at 3:23 PM, Jan Algermissen
> > <jan.algermisse=
n@...> wrote:
> > >
> > > - Should all URIs a server makes known to =
clients be considered
> > > possible bookmarks?
> >
> > Yes, absolutely! Th=
ere is no way to prevent clients from remembering
> > particular URIs so we=
 must assume that all URIs might be bookmarked.
>
> I agree.  Take web page=
s and their images: the primary use case is to show images embedded in web =
pages in a browser; this is the application. One can argue that web pages s=
hould be bookmarkable as steady states, and that images (not a typical stea=
dy state) need not be bookmarkable.
>
> But the bookmarkability of images i=
s what made Google's image search possible, and is an example of serendipit=
ous reuse not envisioned by the original authors of web pages.

Hey, that i=
s a perfect illustration of the point that the server has no idea what the =
use case of the client is. Thanks!

Jan


> --
> -mogsie-
>
>
>
